I remember thinking how boring this game sounds, and oh boy, I was so wrong...

The game story is so good that even if some other puzzle games such as Qube/The-Talos-principle/Turing-test had some better puzzles, still they never gave a complementary story as good as Portal.

And now off to see how good is portal 2...
10/10 The cake is a lie.

The story is best left unspoiled (mostly because saying anything might give what little there is away) but is built like a short story from a novelist. It's a piece of a bigger puzzle and one that while tiny is certainly entertaining as it goes. There are little clues here and there hinting at what you, an older Asian woman, are doing in Aperture Labs and even more clues on how this all relates to the Half-Life universe. Anyways a good game.
Great game. A classic.
A titan of the puzzle game community. Humerous and engaging story.

I am just going to come out and say that this is the only boss fight (from a valve game) that I have actually enjoyed. It was a really fun game I must say, you really have to use your brain. And to be fair I only checked google/Youtube once or twice. The only problem I had with this game was that it was too hard but other than that it is a really fun game that you can finish in one sitting if you really enjoy it.
SNYM

Great game to play, not as long and story rich as Portal 2, and the graphics aren't holding up as well either, but still a really good game to play. I recommend this to anyone who wants to have fun and solve puzzles.

PS Play this before you play Portal 2 if you want to understand the story
